title: New Zealand amends travel warning for SL
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); New Zealand has amended its travel advisory level for Sri Lanka from “avoid non-essential travel” to “exercise increased caution”.

Accordingly, the amended travel restriction states for New Zealanders to exercise increased caution in Sri Lanka due to the ‘potential for civil unrest, the current economic crisis and the ongoing threat of terrorism.’
Moreover, the advisory highlights that the country’s economic situation has deteriorated significantly in recent months, citing shortages of food, essentials and fuel.

Previously, the United Kingdom lifted its ‘All but essential’ travel restriction for Sri Lanka. However, the FCDO advises UK citizens who are in Sri Lanka at this time, or considering travel, to check local information and stay away from protests.
The U.S. Government too requests its citizens to reconsider travel to Sri Lanka due to fuel and medicine shortages, while maintaining a Level 3 travel advisory for Sri Lanka since May 16th.
